p: Diabetes-like hyperglycaemia in rats was induced chemically by a single intraperitoneal injection of 60 mg/kg STZ dissolved in 10 mM citrate buffer (pH 4.5). To prevent the drug-induced hypoglycaemic shock, the rats were given 5% glucose water for 2 days following STZ injection (Gurukar et al. 2013). Animals with fasting blood glucose levels higher than 11 mmol/L after a week of injection were considered diabetic (Dong et al. 2014). The rats in the normal control group were injected with the same volume of isotonic NaCl.
